description: The patient additional demographic segment contains demographic information that is likely to change about the patient.

1.name: Living Dependency
1.description: This field identifies specific living conditions (e.g., spouse dependent on patient, walk-up) that are relevant to an evaluation of the patient’s healthcare needs. This information can be used for discharge planning. Examples might include Spouse Dependent, Medical Supervision Required, Small Children Dependent. This field repeats because, for example, “spouse dependent” and “medical supervision required” can apply at the same time. Refer to user-defined table 0223 - Living dependency for suggested values
1.data_type: IS - Coded value for user-defined tables

10.name: Duplicate Patient
10.description: This field indicates that a patient is the same as, or a duplicate of, another patient found on the sending system. The intent is to be informational only and no action is required by the receiver. Include the patient identifier if the sender knows an identifier for the patient
10.data_type: CX - Extended Composite ID With Check Digit

11.name: Publicity Indicator
11.description: This field contains a user-defined code indicating what level of publicity is allowed (e.g., No Publicity, Family Only) for the patient. This code is conveyed at the patient level rather than the visit level. It is up to the application to decide processing rules for patient vs. visit-level data. Refer to user-defined table 0215 - Publicity code for suggested values. Refer to PV2-21-visit publicity code for visit level code

12.name: Protection Indicator
12.description: This field identifies the person’s protection that determines, in turn, whether access to information about this person should be kept from users who do not have adequate authority for the patient. This indicator is conveyed at the patient level rather that the visit level. It is up to the application to decide processing rules for patient vs. visit level data. Refer to Chapter 2, HL7 table 0136 - Yes/no indicator for valid values. Refer to PV2-22-visit protection indicator for visit level code
12.data_type: ID - Coded values for HL7 tables

2.name: Living Arrangement
2.description: This field identifies the situation in which the patient lives at his residential address. Examples might include Alone, Family, Relatives, Institution, etc. Refer to user-defined table 0220 - Patient living arrangement for suggested values
2.data_type: IS - Coded value for user-defined tables

3.name: Patient Primary Facility
3.description: This field contains the name and identifier that specifies the primary care facility selected by the patient at the time of enrollment in an HMO Insurance Plan. Multiple facilities are allowed for the same facility. The legal name of the facility must be sent in the first sequence. If the legal name of the facility is not sent, then the repeat delimiter must be sent in the first sequence. See Chapter 2 regarding suggested values for organization name type codes
3.data_type: XON - Extended Composite Name And ID For Organizations

4.name: Patient Primary Care Provider Name & ID No.
4.description: This field contains the provider name and ID of the managed care primary care provider. This information is usually selected by the patient at the time of enrollment in the patient’s managed care insurance plan. Multiple names are allowed for the same person. The legal name must be sent in the first sequence. If the legal name is not sent, then the repeat delimiter must be sent in the first sequence
4.data_type: XCN - Extended Composite ID Number And Name

5.name: Student Indicator
5.description: This field indicates if the patient is currently a student or not, and whether the patient is a fulltime or a part-time student. This field does not indicate the student’s degree level (high school, college, elementary) or the student’s field of study (accounting, engineering, etc.). Refer to user-defined table 0231 - Student status for suggested values
5.data_type: IS - Coded value for user-defined tables

6.name: Handicap
6.description: This field indicates the nature of the patient’s permanent handicapped condition (e.g., deaf, blind). A handicapped condition is defined as a physical or mental disability that is permanent. Transient handicapped conditions should be sent in the ambulatory status. Refer to user-defined table 0295 - Handicap for suggested values
6.data_type: IS - Coded value for user-defined tables

7.name: Living Will
7.description: This field indicates whether or not the patient has a living will and, if so, whether a copy of the living will is on file at the facility. If the patient does not have a living will, the value of this field indicates whether the patient was provided information on living wills. Refer to user-defined table 0315 - Living will for suggested values
7.data_type: IS - Coded value for user-defined tables

8.name: Organ Donor
8.description: This field indicates whether the patient wants to donate his/her organs and whether his organ donor card is on file with the organization. Refer to user-defined table 0316 - Organ donor for suggested values
8.data_type: IS - Coded value for user-defined tables

9.name: Separate Bill
9.description: This field specifies that charges for this patient are to be billed separately from other patient bills with the same guarantor. (This bill is now a patient bill rather than a guarantor bill.) Refer to HL7 table 0136 - Yes/no indicator for valid values
9.data_type: ID - Coded values for HL7 tables
